abstract: AT&T says disappointing third-quarter earnings reflect steep decline in iPhone activations; profit was $3.6 billion, or 61 cents a share, compared with profit of $12.3 billion, or $2.07 a share, in year-ago quarter.
snippet: The nation’s biggest telecommunications company said it activated only 2.7 million iPhones in the third quarter, the lowest number in a while.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s biggest telecommunications company said it activated only 2.7 million iPhones in the third quarter, the lowest number in a while.

headline.main: Fewer iPhone Activations Hamper Growth at AT&T
headline.print_headline: Fewer iPhone Activations Hamper Growth at AT&T
headline.seo: AT&T Reports Sluggish Quarter, Meeting Expectations
